etymologies: early 19th century: from earlier lug ‘lugworm’ (of unknown origin) + worm

definitions: a bristle worm that lives in muddy sand. It is widely used as bait for fishing.

notes.text: Genus Arenicola, class Polychaeta: several species, including the northern lugworm, A. marina, which leaves characteristic worm casts on lower shores

shortDefinitions: bristle worm that lives in muddy sand
